newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end sharply up on NCD issues.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end sharply up on NCD issues.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed sharply higher on Tuesday following the central bank's recent issues of negotiable certificates of deposit to mop up excess liquidity, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate ended at 5.837 percent against Monday's 5.335 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.75-6.00 percent against 5.25-5.50.
The central bank issued T$5 billion NCDs on Monday and T$3 billion more on Tuesday.
Dealers expected the rates to hover around six percent on Wednesday.
